build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.name: create-id-with-trailing-garbage
build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.description: Attempts to create a plugin instance using an existing plugin ID with some extra text appended to the end. This should return a null pointer.

build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.name: preset-discovery-crawl
build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.description: If the plugin supports the preset discovery mechanism, then this test ensures that all of the plugin's declared locations can be indexed successfully.

status.details: The plugin does not implement the 'clap.preset-discovery-factory/draft-2' factory.

build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.name: preset-discovery-descriptor-consistency
build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.description: Ensures that all preset provider descriptors from a preset discovery factory match those stored in the providers created by the factory.

status.details: The plugin does not implement the 'clap.preset-discovery-factory/draft-2' factory.

build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.name: preset-discovery-load
build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.description: The same as 'preset-discovery-crawl', but also tries to load all found presets for plugins supported the CLAP plugin library. A single plugin instance is reused for loading multiple presets, and the process function is called after loading each preset.

status.details: The plugin does not implement the 'clap.preset-discovery-factory/draft-2' factory.

build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.name: query-factory-nonexistent
build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.description: Tries to query a factory from the plugin's entry point with a non-existent ID. This should return a null pointer.

build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.name: scan-rtld-now
build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.description: Checks whether the plugin loads correctly when loaded using 'dlopen(..., RTLD_LOCAL | RTLD_NOW)'. Only run on Unix-like platforms.

build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.name: scan-time
build_local/LocusQ_artefacts/Release/CLA.description: Checks whether the plugin can be scanned in under 100 milliseconds.

status.details: The plugin can be scanned in 4 milliseconds.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: descriptor-consistency
com.noizefield.locusq.description: The plugin descriptor returned from the plugin factory and the plugin descriptor stored on the 'clap_plugin object should be equivalent.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: features-categories
com.noizefield.locusq.description: The plugin needs to have at least one of the main CLAP category features.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: features-duplicates
com.noizefield.locusq.description: The plugin's features array should not contain any duplicates.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: param-conversions
com.noizefield.locusq.description: Asserts that value to string and string to value conversions are supported for ether all or none of the plugin's parameters, and that conversions between values and strings roundtrip consistently.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: param-fuzz-basic
com.noizefield.locusq.description: Generates 50 sets of random parameter values, sets those on the plugin, and has the plugin process 5 buffers of random audio and note events. The plugin passes the test if it doesn't produce any infinite or NaN values, and doesn't crash.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: param-set-wrong-namespace
com.noizefield.locusq.description: Sends events to the plugin with the 'CLAP_EVENT_PARAM_VALUE' event tyep but with a mismatching namespace ID. Asserts that the plugin's parameter values don't change.

status.details: Sending events with type ID 5 (CLAP_EVENT_PARAM_VALUE) and namespace ID 0xb33f to the plugin caused its parameter values to change. This should not happen. The plugin may not be checking the event's namespace ID.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: process-audio-out-of-place-basic
com.noizefield.locusq.description: Processes random audio through the plugin with its default parameter values and tests whether the output does not contain any non-finite or subnormal values. Uses out-of-place audio processing.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: process-note-inconsistent
com.noizefield.locusq.description: Sends intentionally inconsistent and mismatching note and MIDI events to the plugin with its default parameter values and tests the output for consistency. Uses out-of-place audio processing.

status.details: The plugin implements the 'clap.note-ports' extension but it does not have any input note ports.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: process-note-out-of-place-basic
com.noizefield.locusq.description: Sends audio and random note and MIDI events to the plugin with its default parameter values and tests the output for consistency. Uses out-of-place audio processing.

status.details: The plugin implements the 'clap.note-ports' extension but it does not have any input note ports.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: state-buffered-streams
com.noizefield.locusq.description: Performs the same state and parameter reproducibility check as in 'state-reproducibility-basic', but this time the plugin is only allowed to read a small prime number of bytes at a time when reloading and resaving the state.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: state-invalid
com.noizefield.locusq.description: The plugin should return false when 'clap_plugin_state::load()' is called with an empty state.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: state-reproducibility-basic
com.noizefield.locusq.description: Randomizes a plugin's parameters, saves its state, recreates the plugin instance, reloads the state, and then checks whether the parameter values are the same and whether saving the state once more results in the same state file as before. The parameter values are updated using the process function.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: state-reproducibility-flush
com.noizefield.locusq.description: Randomizes a plugin's parameters, saves its state, recreates the plugin instance, sets the same parameters as before, saves the state again, and then asserts that the two states are identical. The parameter values are set updated using the process function to create the first state, and using the flush function to create the second state.

com.noizefield.locusq.name: state-reproducibility-null-cookies
com.noizefield.locusq.description: The exact same test as state-reproducibility-basic, but with all cookies in the parameter events set to null pointers. The plugin should handle this in the same way as the other test case.
